body: My code is from a self-hosted Gerrit instance that only has a single part in the URL. CheckSCM() that is called as part of setting defaults is failing because it does not conform to the 2-part path format.

that's a completely different issue then... 

also gerrit is not officially supported.

> that's a completely different issue then...
> 
> also gerrit is not officially supported.

I apologise for mentioning non-related information that distracts from the main point. Replace Gerrit with "any other non Github/Gitlab/Gitea" SCM - it doesn't matter. I was trying to explain why this _is_ a problem for non Github/Gitlab/Gitea remotes.

The relevant point is, the `release` pipe is not needed, and is already disabled in the config, but the SCM URL format is still being enforced through the invocation of a disabled defaulter.

If we can skip invoking disabled defaulters, then all will be good.

> If we can skip invoking disabled defaulters, then all will be good.

I hate to actually, but, actually, it depends... the SCM URL might be used later as a default for, for example, homebrew taps... 

anyway, I'll look into it.

issue.title: Skip invoking Default() for disabled pipes

issue.title: feat: allow goreleaser to run in gerrit, soft-serve and others

labels.name: size/L
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 100-499 lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.body:
Currently, GoReleaser will assume you're running against github, gitea or gitlab.

You could set `release.disable: true`, but it would still set and try to use some defaults that could break things up.

Now, if you disable the release, goreleaser will not set these defaults. It'll also hard error in some cases in which it would happily produce invalid resources before, namely, if `release.disable` is set, and, for example, `brews.url_template` is empty (in which case it would try to use the one from the release, usually github).

closes #4208
